Description: Martin?s E series electrics were produced in two broad series, the 18 series (E-18, EM-18 and EB-18 bass) and the 28 series (E-28 and EB-28 bass). All the Martin labeled instruments were made in the USA. The 18 series was Martin?s first solid electric guitar, and was designed by Dick Boak. Unusually, a new 4-digit serial number was used for the 18 and 28 series instruments, starting at 1000. The first production instrument shipped was an EM-18, serial number 1004, in December of 1978. The last was 3645, an EB-18 at some point during 1980. A total of 341 E-18?s, 1,375 EM-18?s and 874 EB-18?s were manufactured, a total of 2,590 instruments. ConditionDescription: Very Good to Excellent condition. Everything works as expected. The controls are scratchy and need cleaning and tuners are stiff to turn butwork fine. Condition is as expected for a guitar that has been stored for several years.
